content: I'm trying to install the FHIR plugin for notepad++. However if I follow the link form http://www.healthintersections.com.au/FhirServer/fhirnpp.htm and choose Notepad++ Plugin release 1.0.18 12/01/2016 I end up on the home page instead of the download (http://www.healthintersections.com.au/FhirServer/npp-install-1.0.18.exe/ with or withouth the slash). Any tips how to install the fhirplugin notepad++?

The FHIR plugin worked great - able to generate narratives quickly that look a lot better than my hack and validate and PUT POST easily. But it spawns dozens of IE windows kind of making it a non starter for me. 1) has this been fixed and 2) I forget where I should post bugs to it is here OK?
Its pretty easy to install http://www.healthintersections.com.au/FhirServer/fhirnpp.htm
just click on a version an follow the instruction. I think that Notepad needs to be closed for a successful update and I usually reinstalled Notepad before updating so really a new install.

The notepad++ plugin with windows 10 had an annoying pop-up about needing an App. making it unuseable. also when I do the xml-json the text gets Ids? added in like:
"div" : "<div B88BF977DA9543B8A5915C84A70F03F7=\"4\" xmlns=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml\"><ol B88BF977DA9543B8A5915C84A70F03F7=\"5\"><li B88BF977DA9543B8A5915C84A70F03F7=\"6\">CareTeam Member: Kurtis Giles, MD Role = Allopathic&Osteopathic Physicians:Internal Medicine:Cardiovascular Disease</li><li B88BF977DA9543B8A5915C84A70F03F7=\"7\">CareTeam Member: Kathy Fielding, MD Role = Behavioral Health&Social Service Providers:Psychologist</li><li B88BF977DA9543B8A5915C84A70F03F7=\"8\">CareTeam Member: Daniel A Johnson Role = Patient (person)</li></ol></div>"
Has anybody had this happen?
will try reinstall and latest version of plugin
Eric - can you do report an issue here please:
https://github.com/grahamegrieve/fhirserver

i'm currently trying to get the notepad++ plugin to work with win10.
I always get Access violation errors. I already tried np++ 6.9.1, 6.9.0 and 6.9.2 with the newest version of the plugin. Has anyone managed to get this working with the current version & win10?
I need to release a new version...

@Patrick Werner, I had the same issue on several computers at home and at work (Win 10 & Win 7). If I do fresh install of any version that is newer than 1.0.13, the plugin doesn't work (access violation).My workaround is to install npp-install-1.0.13.exe first and then to install the latest version of the plugin. Then everything works perfectly.
thanks for the hint, i'll try that
unfortunality the older npp plugins versions can't be downloaded anymore :/
Let me see if I can attach it here. It's .exe file, so might be blocked.
npp-install-1.0.13.exe
thank you so much @Igor Sirkovich it's working now.
You are welcome Patrick.

@Grahame Grieve, when you relase a new version of NPP plugin, could you please look into the installation issue? All versions after 1.0.13 only work if installed on top of a previously working version, but don't want if it's a fresh install.
you have to turn on local extensions in notepad++ - is that the issue? (see the plug-in manager)

Interesting, I didn't see this option. I will look at it when I get to a windows machine. However, version 1.0.13 works well even if this option is off and once 1.0.13 is installed, any newer verions installed on top of it works well too.

Here's a PortableApp version of NotePad++ with the FHIR Plugin installed (don't remember which version). Runs without installation on Win 10 (at least, it does for me):
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/49322447/Notepad%2B%2BPortable.zip

I have released a new version of the plug-in. For now, the plug-in has been updated to support FHIR STU3 candidate. It's my intention to support both DSTU2 and STU3, but additonal work is needed, and I thought I should get a fixed version out (fixed for the obvious errors)

Downloaded 1.0.20 today, installed and started Notepad++ (v. 6.9.2). A pop-up with "Unknown exception" and title "Exception" was displayed.

Tried Plugin -> FHIR -> About
another error box appeared.
any information in the errors?

No specific.

Tested on Windows10. On two different machines. Both as admin and non-admin.

Tried to find a log file for Notepad++, but didn't find it. Images are uploaded to:
https://ibin.co/2wNyrU9aZC7c.png and https://ibin.co/2wNzbNi0zuYQ.png
ok try again
Now it start-up successfully. Thank you for your quick response.
thanks for trying it out

thanks for the update @Grahame Grieve we are currently trying to use your plugin with a local hapi DSTU2 Server. Unfortunately the DSTU2 Server Option in the Plugin settings is always disabled/greyed out. Even after adding our own DSTU2 Server to the list of Servers.
image001.jpg
we are getting this error when we are checking the connection
yes, I disabled that option; I have a little bit more work to do before it can be enabled
and as you found, hooking it up to a server running DSTU2 will just confuse things more. DSTU2 support using STU3 infrastructure is a work in progress

I installed the fhirplugin a month or so ago and it worked great at first, but validation stopped working a couple weeks ago. I started getting the following error in a dialog box entitled "Fetch a resource": Error validating: error: the element CapabilityStatement is not a valid resource name. What am I doing wrong?

(I've tried uninstalling/re-installing the plug-in, deleting associated files, etc. but it still fails)

I also just tried creating a 'Patient' resource using Create New Resource and I received the same error: 'error: the element CapabilityStatement is not a valid resource name.' I suspect that something is wrong in trying to talk to the default configured servers.
ah yes. you're right. I'll try and get an update out sometime over this weekend
Thanks -- It is a valuable tool and we greatly appreciate your work.
ok, done

Just downloaded from @Grahame Grieve ' page and installed the Version 1.0.24 when trying to build a new Resouce(Template) it crashes:
showing an error about an unknown Code GraphDefinition
FhirPluginError.png
I need to do a new release
will try and find time tomorrow
no hurry :)

I'm getting the same exact "unknown exceptions" as Henrik reported (above) in Sept 2016... What was the trick to fix this?
Notepad++ - v7.4.2
Plugin - v1.0.26
I don't know, actually. I've tried to reproduce it and I can't. the original error was a programming error on my part. have you re-installed it?
After re-installing Notepad++, I got it working.
great

Hi @Grahame Grieve When I try any operation (even About) on the Notepad++ Plugin using http://test.fhir.org/r3 for both terminology & FHIR server, I get an error "unknown code: BodyStructure from a set of choice...". I've tried this on 3 different machines and the same error appears on all of them. Notepad++: v7.4.2. Plugin: v1.0.26. I've attached a screenshot with the full error. VirtualBox_Win10_10_08_2017_14_12_19.png

I remember a similar/same issue - perhaps it helps debugging: I got the same thing when running the server with the wrong definitions.json.zip (if i use the r4 in an r3 installation, i get that message)
what do you have in [npp-install]/fhir? there should be 2 zip files, what are their dates?
I released an upgrade that should help... the about box at least should load

There is only one zip file "fhir3-definitions.zip", its date is July 6, 2017. I've checked on 2 machines (one with a new installation and another with an update on top of an older version of the plugin) and it's the same on both.
odd. try the upgrade
With 1.0.27, "About" works, but when I try to validate or create a new resource, I still get a message about "BodyStructure"
what does it say in the about box for the definitions source?
The path seems correct: "C:\Program Files (x86)\Notepad++\plugins\fhir\fhir3-definitions.zip". The date of this file after upgrade is August 4, 2017.
hmm
it's not an install problem then
oh. it's an installer problem - a wrong path in the install config file.
I'll do another release
Thank you
With 1.0.28, everything works perfectly.
great
